name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's classic novel of a lawyer in the Deep South defending a black man charged with the rape of a white girl.

George Orwell's dystopian novel about the dangers of totalitarianism, censorship, and surveillance.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's timeless portrayal of teenage angst and alienation.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's enchanting prelude to The Lord of the Rings.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's witty and romantic tale of manners and marriage in early 19th-century England.

name: The Da Vinci Code
description: Dan Brown's gripping thriller involving a symbologist, a secret society, and a mysterious murder in the Louvre.

name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: J.K. Rowling's magical tale of a young wizard's journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

name: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho's philosophical novel about a shepherd boy's journey to find his destiny.

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy following Frodo Baggins on his quest to destroy the One Ring.
